DataElement.preferredDefinition: the hormonal receptor status of a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the hormone receptor status or description, the ligand binding proteins that bind signalling molecules external to the cell with high affinity and convert this extracellular event into one or more intracellular signals that alter the behavior of the target cell, of a person

Concepts.definition: A human being.

Property.preferredDefinition: Ligand binding proteins that bind signalling molecules external to the cell with high affinity and convert this extracellular event into one or more intracellular signals that alter the behavior of the target cell.  The hormone receptor can be cytoplasmic/nuclear, or associated with the cell membrane in the case of receptors whose ligands cannot penetrate the membrane.:Description; a statement that represents something in words.

Concepts.definition: Ligand binding proteins that bind signalling molecules external to the cell with high affinity and convert this extracellular event into one or more intracellular signals that alter the behavior of the target cell.  The hormone receptor can be cytoplasmic/nuclear, or associated with the cell membrane in the case of receptors whose ligands cannot penetrate the membrane.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

PermissibleValues.value: ER positive and/or PgR positive and HER2 negative
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Positive Progesterone Receptor Status Positive Her2/Neu Status Negative Estrogen Receptor Status

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Positive Progesterone Receptor Status Positive Her2/Neu Status Negative Estrogen Receptor Status
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involving advantage or good.: Indicates the progesterone receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases. (>=10 is positive if measured in fmols/mg cytosol protein; Otherwise use institutional standards): Involving advantage or good.: The presence or absence of Her2/Neu on a tissue sample.: Negative; involving disadvantage or harm.: The estrogen receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases.  There are essentially two distinct forms of breast cancer, one that tends to have an early onset and is characterized by an ER- status, and one that tends to have a late onset and

Concepts.definition: Involving advantage or good.
Indicates the progesterone receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases. (>=10 is positive if measured in fmols/mg cytosol protein; Otherwise use institutional standards)
Involving advantage or good.
The presence or absence of Her2/Neu on a tissue sample.
Involving disadvantage or harm.

The estrogen receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases.  There are essentially two distinct forms of breast cancer, one that tends to have an early onset and is characterized by an ER- status, and one that tends to have a late onset and is characterized by an ER+ status.  However, these two variants tend to overlap with respect to age, so it is possible for a young woman to have a "late-onset" form of breast cancer and for an older woman to have an "early-onset" variant of the disease.

PermissibleValues.value: HER2 positive (either 3+ by IHC or FISH amplified)

Concepts.definition: Involving advantage or good.

The estrogen receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases.  There are essentially two distinct forms of breast cancer, one that tends to have an early onset and is characterized by an ER- status, and one that tends to have a late onset and is characterized by an ER+ status.  However, these two variants tend to overlap with respect to age, so it is possible for a young woman to have a "late-onset" form of breast cancer and for an older woman to have an "early-onset" variant of the disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than seventeen and less than nineteen and the quantity that it denotes.: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.: Subsequent to; after.: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
